alert.note: Alert for Concho; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Menard and south central Concho Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 427 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Camp Sol Mayer, or near Fort Mckavett, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Menard, Fort Mckavett, Live Oak, Camp Sol Mayer, Us- 83 Near The Menard-Concho County Line and The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Highway 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
